channel.title: Is there anyway of makin trisidiax v3 more stable?
channel.description:
[b]im running a trisidiax v3 source and client but with so much added and so many hours spent with around 20 players active and online
but sometimes the server might go offline because of the lagg. and also pking and funpk give me an error of <eventmanager> i did make a post about that but i still havent fixed it
any ideas guysss?? skype:haviland41 :|[/b]

item.title: Is there anyway of makin trisidiax v3 more stable?
item.dc:creator: @supernova3 supernova_
item.description:
@supernova3 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:7, topic:538951”][quote author=supernova_ link=topic=657787.msg4401919#msg4401919 date=1390849147]

Funpk shouldn’t even be running on event manager, and neither should anything that is related to pking.

Add a cycle-based event handler and convert your events into that. Also, look into cleaning up the process() in Client.java.

You’re going to want to redo a lot of the server, if you truly want to be stable. Like Combat, for instance, that’s the worst part of trisidia.

Using an event manager would be virtually pointless as they run on a 600ms tick, and as far as I’m aware a project insanity runs on a 500ms game tick. If you were to start utilizing things with a 600ms tick while your server is running on a 500ms wouldn’t that throw the game server out of equilibrium?
[/quote]
Pi runs at 600ms a tick, you can always change that in Server.java:
cycleRate = 600;
As far as I know, there isn’t a server running on 500ms a tick.[/quote]

From what I remember when I looked at a project insanity it was on a 500ms tick rate.

Edit: Must just be senility setting in at a fairly young age.

Read full topic
item.source: Is there anyway of makin trisidiax v3 more stable?

Funpk shouldn’t even be running on event manager, and neither should anything that is related to pking.

Add a cycle-based event handler and convert your events into that. Also, look into cleaning up the process() in Client.java.

You’re going to want to redo a lot of the server, if you truly want to be stable. Like Combat, for instance, that’s the worst part of trisidia.
[/quote]

Using an event manager would be virtually pointless as they run on a 600ms tick, and as far as I’m aware a project insanity runs on a 500ms game tick. If you were to start utilizing things with a 600ms tick while your server is running on a 500ms wouldn’t that throw the game server out of equilibrium?[/quote]
Pi runs at 600ms a tick, you can always change that in Server.java:
cycleRate = 600;
As far as I know, there isn’t a server running on 500ms a tick.

item.title: Is there anyway of makin trisidiax v3 more stable?
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

no there’s no way to magically make trisidia more “stable” unless you re-wrote basically the entire server, which is pointless because you might as well use a server that isn’t garbage to begin with

ohokay:

The solution is simple. Step away from trisidia

im sorry. there’s no other way. if you want to avoid this problem in the future, do not use project insanity, delta, allstar, or any other winterlove bases.

Read full topic
